headline: The S&P 500, Nasdaq Are Falling. This Week’s AI Rally Is Losing Steam.
summary: The stock market wavered on Tuesday after a pair of headlines knocked some of the wind out of the artificial-intelligence rally’s sails. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 50 points, or 0.1%. The S&P 500 was down 0.

headline: How Lam Research’s (LRCX) New $16 Billion Shelf Registration Could Reshape Its Capital Strategy
summary: Lam Research Corporation recently announced that its Board of Directors approved a quarterly dividend of US$0.26 per share, while also disclosing changes to its corporate bylaws and a shelf registration filing of approximately US$15.98 billion for potential common stock offerings. These developments point to possible shifts in the company's governance and future capital-raising activities that could influence shareholder rights and corporate strategy. headline: 2 S&P 500 Stocks Worth Your Attention and 1 We Turn Down
summary: While the S&P 500 (^GSPC) includes industry leaders, not every stock in the index is a winner. Some companies are past their prime, weighed down by poor execution, weak financials, or structural headwinds.
